        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.         Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1. Level of complexity (High, Medium, Low - Explain)<!----></span><br>3. Has this been merged to a stable release? beta release?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this been merged to a stable release? beta release?<!----></span><br>4. Overall Recommendation (Yes, No)<span class="line"><!---->4.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1341907%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2200" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1341907%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2200%252526ust%25253D1703404440807860%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3H9LNhKUj_-dffxNjFN9rr%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>

              <!---->
            </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<!----></span><br>    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<!----></span><br>    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<span class="line"><!---->    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<!----></span><br>    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&amp;AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<!----></span><br>                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<!----></span><br>                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<span class="line"><!---->                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<span class="line"><!---->AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<!----></span><br><br>I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<span class="line"><!---->I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<!----></span><br>If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I do not think we have a real attack (or am I wrong) - it is a UAF that we need to fix though. Note that this crash occurs when a profile is destroyed, so in general on browser shut-down.<span class="line"><!---->I do not think we have a real attack (or am I wrong) - it is a UAF that we need to fix though. Note that this crash occurs when a profile is destroyed, so in general on browser shut-down.<!----></span><br><br>I think we should just fix it for the next release branch.<span class="line"><!---->I think we should just fix it for the next release branch.<!----></span><br><br>danakj@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/danakj@chromium.org"><!---->danakj@chromium.org<!----></a>: Do you agree?<span class="line"><!---->: Do you agree?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         LTS Milestone M102<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M102<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 100;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;

          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.           Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: use after free in AccountReconcilor
          (was: Security: use after free in chrome)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)

          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>SignIn
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: use after free in AccountReconcilor
          (was: Security: use after free in chrome)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          msarda@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -danakj@chromium.org droger@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-High FoundIn-102 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-iOS OS-Lacros Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;SignIn
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.
