        Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I do not think we have a real attack (or am I wrong) - it is a UAF that we need to fix though.         I agree that it's a bug.<span class="line"><!---->I agree that it's a bug.<!----></span><br>It's really not new, it was already here in 2014 (e.g. <span class="line"><!---->It's really not new, it was already here in 2014 (e.g. <!----></span>https://codereview.chromium.org/197283019/diff/280001/chrome/browser/signin/account_reconcilor.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://codereview.chromium.org/197283019/diff/280001/chrome/browser/signin/account_reconcilor.cc"><!---->https://codereview.chromium.org/197283019/diff/280001/chrome/browser/signin/account_reconcilor.cc<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br>It happens at profile destruction (if it ever happens at all, it seems it would be super hard to trigger in practice), which means mostly at shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->It happens at profile destruction (if it ever happens at all, it seems it would be super hard to trigger in practice), which means mostly at shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>I don't think this is urgent at all, fixing it on trunk should be enough.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is urgent at all, fixing it on trunk should be enough.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.       This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<!----></span><br>    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<!----></span><br>    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<span class="line"><!---->    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<!----></span><br>    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&amp;AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<!----></span><br>                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<!----></span><br>                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<span class="line"><!---->                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<span class="line"><!---->AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<!----></span><br><br>I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<span class="line"><!---->I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<!----></span><br>If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This patch is injecting code into the browser process, at which point the browser would already be compromised. Can you provide a way to reproduce this without changing the browser process code?<span class="line"><!---->This patch is injecting code into the browser process, at which point the browser would already be compromised. Can you provide a way to reproduce this without changing the browser process code?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I do not think we have a real attack (or am I wrong) - it is a UAF that we need to fix though. Note that this crash occurs when a profile is destroyed, so in general on browser shut-down.<span class="line"><!---->I do not think we have a real attack (or am I wrong) - it is a UAF that we need to fix though. Note that this crash occurs when a profile is destroyed, so in general on browser shut-down.<!----></span><br><br>I think we should just fix it for the next release branch.<span class="line"><!---->I think we should just fix it for the next release branch.<!----></span><br><br>danakj@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/danakj@chromium.org"><!---->danakj@chromium.org<!----></a>: Do you agree?<span class="line"><!---->: Do you agree?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341907#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         LTS Milestone M102<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M102<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2.             Issue 1341907: Security: use after free in AccountReconcilor
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1341907: Security: use after free in AccountReconcilor
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1283894224" title="wxhu...@gmail.com"><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Jul 5, 2022, 2:26 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jul 5, 2022, 2:26 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">

If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.         https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/signin/core/browser/account_reconcilor.cc;l=612<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/signin/core/browser/account_reconcilor.cc;l=612"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/signin/core/browser/account_reconcilor.cc;l=612<!----></a><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<!----></span><br>    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<!----></span><br>    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<span class="line"><!---->    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<!----></span><br>    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()->PostTask(<span class="line"><!---->    base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&amp;AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<!----></span><br>                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<span class="line"><!---->                                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<!----></span><br>                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<span class="line"><!---->                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<span class="line"><!---->AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<!----></span><br><br>I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<span class="line"><!---->I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<!----></span><br>If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<span class="line"><!---->If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: use after free in AccountReconcilor
          (was: Security: use after free in chrome)
          <br>

          Security_Severity-High FoundIn-102 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-iOS OS-Lacros Pri-1

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;SignIn

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (chrome_accounts_changed_) {<!----></span><br>    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->    chrome_accounts_changed_ = false;<!----></span><br>    SetState(AccountReconcilorState::ACCOUNT_RECONCILOR_SCHEDULED);<span class="line"><!----> base::ThreadTaskRunnerHandle::Get()-&gt;PostTask(<!----></span><br>        FROM_HERE, base::BindOnce(&AccountReconcilor::StartReconcile,<span class="line"><!---->        FROM_HERE,                  base::Unretained(this),  // use base::unretain(this)<!----></span><br>                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<span class="line"><!---->                                  Trigger::kTokenChangeDuringReconcile));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<span class="line"><!---->AccountReconcilor is KeyedService, will be destoryed when profile destoryed.<!----></span><br><br>I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<span class="line"><!---->I use my patch to win race condition, and I didn't see any check in this class.<!----></span><br>If you have any questions, please tell me, thanks.<span         Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b issue.<b class="line"><!---->Please provide a brief explanation of the security issue.<!----></b><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<b class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [x.x.x.x] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></b><br>Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<b class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Please indicate OS, version, and service pack level]<!----></b><br>windows<span class="line"><!---->windows<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.         Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<span class="line"><!---->Ok I have looked again. I see that AccountReconcilor is posting a task with `this` bound as the receiver, via Unretained. Posting a task loses all control of what happens next.<!----></span><br><br>The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<span class="line"><!---->The owner of AccountReconcilor is KeyedServiceFactory, which is a general container and has no means to watch for the posted callback and wait for it to complete.<!----></span><br><br>With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<span class="line"><!---->With BRP raw_ptr, the `this` object will be poisoned but not freed (where BRP is enabled).<!----></span><br><br>The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<span class="line"><!---->The post-task was last changed in early 2021:<!----></span><br><br>Commit b9e210c : <span class="line"><!---->Commit b9e210c : <!----></span>droger@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/droger@chromium.org"><!---->droger@chromium.org<!----></a> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<span class="line"><!----> @ 2021-05-04 6:59 AM<!----></span><br>[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<span class="line"><!---->[signin] Add per-trigger histograms for AccountReconcilor<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations on another one! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $5,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being fairly mitigated by race condition and being a shutdown bug. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations on another one! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $5,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being fairly mitigated by race condition and being a shutdown bug. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
